snippet: The city’s Muslims do not often work together politically, but they have found common ground in the fight to close public schools for Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.
abstract: Push to close New York City's public schools for Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha, most sacred Muslim holidays, has managed to unify the city's Muslims; Muslims in New York often find it difficult to work together politically because of differences in national origin, language, sect and class.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Muslims do not often work together politically, but they have found common ground in the fight to close public schools for Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha.

headline.main: Muslims in New York City Unite on Push to Add Holidays to School Calendar
headline.print_headline: Fight to Add Two Holidays to School Calendar Unites City’s Muslims
